Detailed Description

Wait Handler Service.

Description:
Wait handlers provide callbacks for when I/O events occur. They provide a wait to service many I/O file descriptors without requiring a thread per descriptor.
See also:
mprDisableWaitEvents, mprEnableWaitEvents, mprRecallWaitHandler, MprWaitHandler, mprCreateEvent, mprServiceDispatcher, MprEvent

Function Documentation

MprWaitHandler* mprCreateWaitHandler ( MprCtx  ctx,
int  fd,
int  mask,
MprDispatcher *  dispatcher,
MprEventProc  proc,
void *  data 
)

Create a wait handler.

Description:
Create a wait handler that will be invoked when I/O of interest occurs on the specified file handle The wait handler is registered with the MPR event I/O mechanism.
Parameters:
ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
fd File descriptor
mask Mask of events of interest. This is made by oring MPR_READABLE and MPR_WRITABLE
dispatcher Dispatcher object to use for scheduling the I/O event.
proc Callback function to invoke when an I/O event of interest has occurred.
data Data item to pass to the callback
Returns:
A new wait handler registered with the MPR event mechanism

void mprDisableWaitEvents ( MprWaitHandler *  wp  ) 

Disable wait events.

Description:
Disable wait events for a given file descriptor.
Parameters:
wp Wait handler created via mprCreateWaitHandler

void mprEnableWaitEvents ( MprWaitHandler *  wp,
int  desiredMask 
)

Enable wait events.

Description:
Enable wait events for a given file descriptor.
Parameters:
wp Wait handler created via mprCreateWaitHandler
desiredMask Mask of desirable events (MPR_READABLE | MPR_WRITABLE)

MprWaitHandler* mprInitWaitHandler ( MprCtx  ctx,
MprWaitHandler *  wp,
int  fd,
int  mask,
MprDispatcher *  dispatcher,
MprEventProc  proc,
void *  data 
)

Statically initialize a wait handler.

Description:
Initialize a wait handler that will be invoked when I/O of interest occurs on the specified file handle The wait handler is registered with the MPR event I/O mechanism.
Parameters:
ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
wp Wait handler structure to initialize
fd File descriptor
mask Mask of events of interest. This is made by oring MPR_READABLE and MPR_WRITABLE
dispatcher Dispatcher object to use for scheduling the I/O event.
proc Callback function to invoke when an I/O event of interest has occurred.
data Data item to pass to the callback
Returns:
A new wait handler registered with the MPR event mechanism

void mprRecallWaitHandler ( MprCtx  ctx,
int  fd 
)

Recall a wait handler.

Description:
Signal that a wait handler should be recalled at the earliest opportunity. This is useful when a protocol stack has buffered data that must be processed regardless of whether more I/O occurs.
Parameters:
ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
fd File descriptor to recall
